Enlarged with an addition of the Scottishe kinges lineallie discended from him to Charles now Prince, together with a note of the beginninges of the most parte of the antie [n] t and famous nobilitie of Scotland. A historye both pleasant and profitable set forthe and done in heroik verse by Patrick Gordon Gentleman
monogr.author: Gordon, Patrick

div.head: To the Author.
div.l: IF Allexander wish'd, (yit sighd') to see,
That famous tombe, wher fierce Achilles lay
Thow worthie chiftain, euer blesd quod he,
Had Homers penn, thy praises to display,
And if Eneas danger, night and day
And long some labours, bothe by sea and land,
Are recompensd, and more: and he for ay,
Famos'd, be Maroes martial pen doe stand.
Mak Allexander judge, fame shall avow
Bruce hath his guerdone of a Gordon now.
